data.title: As Liz Hurley parties with Hugh Grant at son Damian's film premiere, the other celebs and royals who are still very friendly with their former flames
data.meta_description: These famous faces seem to pride themselves on staying the best of pals with their exes - including British actress Liz Hurley and Hugh Grant,
data.text:
Some people can't bear to be in the same room as a former partner once a relationship has ended, let alone remain friendly with them.

Yet for these famous faces, they seem to pride themselves on staying the best of pals with their exes - despite often decades of separations.

Take Liz Hurley and Hugh Grant. The actress , 58, who dated Hugh, 63, for 13 years, has often described her former flame as my best friend after remaining good pals following their split over 20 years ago.

They even both attended the London film premiere for her latest film Strictly Confidential, which was directed and written by Liz's son Damian, 22, whose godfather is Hugh.

The British model was also joined by another ex, Arun Nayar, on Wednesday. The multi-millionaire textile, 59, heir has remained good friends with the actress since their divorce. They were married from 2007 to 2011.

But Liz isn't the only well-known name who is friendly with a former partner. We round up the household names who keep their friends close - and their exes closer...

Liz Hurley and Hugh Grant

Dated for 13 years (1987-2000)

Elizabeth Hurley and Hugh Grant have remained good friends over the years following their split over 20 years ago.

Hugh is now happily married to television producer, Anna Elisabet Eberstein, after the pair tied the knot in 2018.

Elizabeth was a struggling actress when she met heart-throb actor Hugh on a film set in 1987. Their romance blossomed into a 13-year relationship that catapulted her into the spotlight.

Their red-carpet appearances - and Lizs ever-skimpier outfits - made them Hollywood darlings, and she stuck by him in 1995 when he was arrested in Los Angeles for lewd conduct with a prostitute.

Hugh, who was fined 900, admitted that he had been an idiot.

Five years later, the relationship fizzled out, with Liz suggesting his moods were to blame: My friends used to call him Grumpelstiltskin.

They stayed friends, and model Liz even made Hugh godfather to her son Damian. She often describes the actor as my best friend. Meanwhile, he says: We went from zero to somewhere together.

Gwyneth Paltrow and Chris Martin

Married for 13 years (2003-2016)

Actress and wellness guru Gwyneth Paltrow, 51, met Coldplay frontman Chris Martin, 47, backstage at one of his concerts in 2002.

A whirlwind romance followed, culminating in a secret wedding the following year.

They set up home in London, where their children Apple, 19, and Moses, 18, were born - but in 2014, the conscious uncoupling statement appeared on Gwyneths lifestyle website Goop and the couple divorced in 2016.

Despite moving to LA, she has kept in close contact with Chris and often posts sweet tributes to him on Instagram, despite her marriage in 2018 to producer Brad Falchuk.

She has previously described the singer - now dating actress Dakota Johnson - as 'kind of like my brother now'.

Dakota and Chris have kept their romance private since they first began their relationship in late 2017.

They met through mutual friends and have 'never really left each other' since, the actress told Vanity Fair in June 2022.

Gwyneth, meanwhile, said about Dakota: 'We're actually very good friends. I love her so much. She's an adorable, wonderful person.'

Sarah Ferguson and Prince Andrew

Married for ten years (19861996)

It's been 28 years since they divorced - yet earlier this year speculation was mounting that the Duke and Duchess of York were thinking about marrying again.

Sarah, affectionately known as Fergie, and Prince Andrew, both 64, first met at the age of three on the sidelines of a polo field, her parents told the Washington Post in 1986.

Princess Diana, who was Fergie's best friend from the time they were teenagers, officially reacquainted the pair later in the 1980s, following her marriage to the now King Charles in 1981.

With the duo continuing to run into one another at various events, Sarah and Prince Andrew quickly became an item.

Just five months after their engagement announcement, Prince Andrew and Fergie married at Westminster Abbey in London on July 23, 1986. They later welcomed two daughters Princesses Beatrice and Eugenie.

But after nearly six years of marriage, Fergie and Prince Andrew separated on 19 March 1992. They divorced in 1996 but decided to still live with one another - and have continued to do so nearly thirty years on.

The pair still share a home, living at Royal Lodge in Windsor Great Park, the ten-bedroom former residence of the Queen Mother.

Sarah told the Daily Mail in 2018: 'We're the happiest divorced couple in the world. We're divorced to each other, not from each other.'

The pair have both remained devoted to raising their daughters, and have since made numerous public appearances together as a family unit.

Kate Beckinsale and Michael Sheen

Together for eight years (1995-2003)

Cosy Instagram pictures, declarations of love for one another and frequent family outings with their daughter Lily... it would be easy to think that actors Kate Beckinsale, 50, and Michael Sheen, 55, were still an item.

Having met on stage in 1995, when Kate was 21, they moved in together soon afterwards and worked on several joint projects, including an audiobook of Romeo And Juliet.

Kate gave birth to their daughter in early 1999, but later admitted she was embarrassed that Michael never proposed.

They separated in 2003, shortly after filming their movie Underworld  whose director, Len Wiseman, Kate would marry the following year.

But the split was amicable from the start, with Kate describing Sheen as really dear, close family . . . I love him a lot.

Discussing her and Sheens closeness in 2016, Kate said: Its so normal for us. We have been not together far longer than we were ever together.

Gary Lineker and Danielle Bux

Married for seven years (2009-2016)

Gary Lineker and his ex-wife Danielle Bux proved they are very much the amicable former couple as they enjoyed a holiday together in Ibiza in the summer of 2023.

Match of the Day presenter Gary, 63, and actress Danielle, 44, who divorced in 2016, appeared to be getting along during their trip to the White Isle with family and friends, as the duo enjoyed a cosy exchange and chatted fondly.

A witness told The Sun: 'It was hard to think Gary and Danielle are not blissfully married. They looked so relaxed and intimate in each others company.

'They have re-written the rulebook on how a divorced couple can get on. They clearly still adore each other.'

In 2019, Gary revealed that he speaks to Danielle three times a day, as he insisted they are still 'best mates'.

Admitting his bond with his wife is 'unusual', he told The Mirror: 'Danielle and I are best mates, we still speak three times a day, we text all the time.'

He added: 'When she comes to London she stays with me, and when I go to LA I see her.' Gary was first married to Michelle Cockayne in 1986. The couple have four sons.

They split after a 20-year marriage and three years later, in 2009, Gary married former lingerie model Danielle, who is 19 years his junior.

Sienna Miller and Tom Sturridge

Dated for four years (2011-2015)

Sienna Miller and Tom Sturridge have remained on good terms following their split in 2015.

Tom is now in a relationship with Alexa Chung while Sienna this year welcomed a daughter with her boyfriend Oli Green.

However, the blonde beauty, 42, has remained close with her former fianc Tom, 38, and the pair are often seen spending time together. The couple split eight years ago and share a daughter Marlowe, 11.

Sienna previously gushed to Harper's Bazaar that Tom was her 'best friend in the entire world' - and that while they don't share a property, they often stay together to spend mutual time with their little girl.

Admitting their close bond has not broken since they cut romantic ties in the summer of 2015 after four years together, she explained: We still love each other.

'I think in a break-up somebody has to be a little bit cruel in order for it to be traditional, but its not been acrimonious in a way where you would choose to not be around that person.'

Sienna has also given her seal of approval for her ex and Alexa and in December 2022 told Vogue UK: 'I'm really happy for them. It's genuinely lovely.'

Madonna and Sean Penn

Married for 4 years (1985-1989)

Pop icon Madonna, 65, had a volatile relationship with actor Sean Penn, 63, from the start, marred by violent outbursts - including one incident in which he was arrested for assaulting a photographer.

They met in 1985 and married the same year - only for Madonna to file for divorce two years later, withdraw the papers and then file them again in 1989.

There were allegations that he had hit her during their marriage, but Madonna branded these false and malicious, declaring Sean the coolest guy in the universe.

Somehow, against all odds, the pair remained friends. At a charity fundraiser in 2016, Madonna told her ex: Im still in love with you. Yes. In fact, I think I love you more now that were divorced.

She also offered to remarry him if he bid $150,000 for an auction item - which he duly did (though he was later outbid).

It seems the feeling is mutual. In 2018, Sean declared: I love my first wife very much.'

Bruce Willis and Demi Moore

In a world full of fractured relationships and bitter divorces, Bruce Willis' blended family bliss is somewhat of an enigma.

Since the Die Hard star's devastating dementia diagnosis, his adoring family have rallied around him.

Bruce, 69, married actress Demi Moore, 61, in 1987 but the pair separated in 2000. As Demi found love with younger actor Ashton Kutcher, 46, (who she split from 2011), Bruce later fell for English model and actress Emma Heming, who is almost 25 years his junior.

But Bruce, Demi and Emma were determined to remain friends for the sake of their children - Bruce and Demi have three daughters together and he and Emma have two - and the couples became close.

'We've become like a tribe,' Bruce said of their blended family while speaking with W Magazine in 2009, after Ashton and Demi attended his Turks and Caicos wedding to Emma.

Emma said that she met Demi and Ashton early on in her relationship to Bruce, saying she was 'really blessed because from day one it's been comfortable and fun.'

Bruce has previously noted that people are often baffled by his friendship with Demi - with whom he shares children Rumer, 35, Scout, 32 and Tallulah, 30.

'It's generated a lot of interest because everyone can understand resentment and envy in the breakup of a marriage, but they don't understand how I can get along with my ex like that,' he said.

'Demi and I made a choice to put the kids first, and we're really lucky that it turns out we all have fun together.'

Demi and Ashton ended up splitting in 2011, and they finalised their divorce two years later.

Meanwhile, Bruce and Emma went on to welcome their daughter Mabel in 2012. Two years later, they had Evelyn.

Now, 15 years after Bruce and Emma tied the knot, Demi said she considered Bruce's wife and their two kids part of her own 'family,' as she gave an inside look into their unique - but strong - bond.

'We are FAMILY,' she wrote in an Instagram caption under a picture which showed them all enjoying a meal together, posing as a group, and playing with Demi's dog Pilaf. 'Getting into the holiday spirit.'
